Control Sergeant Rex "Power" Colt, a Mark IV Cyber Commando, save the world and get the girl while fighting an army of cyborgs, mutants, and blood dragons.

It is a stand alone title and does not require Far Cry 3 to play it.

142591.name: Morgoth
142591.description:
Box Text

Yea warrior knight brave and true,
Tis time to face Morgoth with deeds to do,
Hast though fearless spirit the skill and might?
Dost thou challenge spider, ghost and ghoul to fight?

Morgoth is a multi-roomed arcade adventure which combines the fast paced skill and action of arcade games with the heroic deeds of an ancient world. It's fully animated, smooth graphics and sound effects highlight the CAVERNS OF MORIA, SMEAGORS KEEP and MIRKWOOD FOREST where you are pitted against a variety of monsters with only your magic bow and arrows for protection. Morgoth is a unique action packed adventure allowing you to wander through the enchanted dominion of Morgoth and collect the lost treasures of KAZARD KALLAHAN. But beware! You must escape before the satanic MORGOTH, being of pure evil, is aroused and seeks yea!

142592.name: Rise of Atlantis
142592.description:
Turn-Based Battle System
Atlantica returns to the roots of traditional RPGs and incorporates classic turn-based combat while combining movement elements for deep strategic action! Experience the tactical combat missing from the modern MMORPG.

Player Versus Player
Test your might and mettle against your fellow players. Participating in the Free Leagues will test your puglistic powers every three hours of the day. And put your money where your boast is by posting a Challenge; then take on all corners wanting to wrest the gold from you.

Source: The Game Website.

142593.name: Combat Arms
142593.description:
Prepare to drop into an ever-changing theatre of conflict, where you are in control of your gameplay- from your fully customizable character, to your lethal arsenal of weapons to the scenarios you want to experience. Experience fierce battles online with up to 15 of your friends (and enemies) in dense jungles,frozen tundras, industrial wastelands, and more!

Grab your gear and get ready for battle...

Source: The Game Website.

COMBAT ARMS is Free to Play. What does this mean? It means you'll never have to pay a cent unless you want to. What you get at game launch will always be available for free, and new free content will be added as well!

Source: The Game Website.

142594.name: Asteroid (TRS-80)
142594.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Asteroids.




Back Cover

DATE: 28.02.2047
LOCATION: 270 million miles from Terra
MISSION: Maintaining Terra's Space Lanes

Briefing will follow:
1.1 Your mission is to destroy any asteroids in your sector and to prevent alient spacecraft from infiltrating the Terran Defense Network.
1.2 Your ship is armed with an anti-matter cannon. You can shoot large asteroids, but this turns then into many smaller asteroids, each capable of destroying your ship.
1.3 In addition, alien ships can make instantaneous hyperspace jumps into your area and start firing on your ship.
1.4 You'll need lightning reflexes and nerves of steel to survive Asteroid. We have no use for non-survivors!

Asteroid, a real-time, machine-language game, features variable levels of difficulty, superb high-speed graphics, sound effects and automatic score keeping.

142595.name: Tycoon
142595.description:
"A rich-man's game".

"The object of the game is for the player to put up as many businesses and make as much money as possible before the game is over."

A Monopoly-like game, minus the bidding and trading, manufactured in the Philippines. 2-6 players move around the track by rolling 2 dice and moves forward as the total roll allows. The player can acquire the business he lands on. If the space is already owned, then the player must pay the owner as indicated in the amount shown in the property card. Players have the option to construct or put up a one-storey or two-storey in any of the business space he own in order to increase it's value. The game ends wen all but one player has declared bankruptcy or when the bank runs out of money.

142596.name: Anodyne
videogamehonor: 2013 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
142596.description:
In Anodyne, you explore and fight your way through nature, urban and abstract themed areas in the human Young's subconscious, evoked by a 16-bit-era visual style and a moody, dream-like soundtrack.

Source: The Game Website.

142597.name: Shahida
142597.description:
From the first chapter of the book

Shahida (Arabic, شهد, دلى بشهادته) means to bear witness or as a noun (شاهد, شهادة, الشاهد) a female witness. It is also the root for two more words: Sha:hid, meaning gravestone, epitaph; and Shahi:d, meaning martyr.

But who is the witness? The ordinary citizen caught in the war zone, the ordinary soldier wondering why he’s fighting or even where he is, the guerrilla or militia fighter wondering the same thing, the prisoner who smuggles out a manuscript, the novelist fearing both the invading army and his or her own government, the journalist defying editorial policy, the veteran turned resister, the aid worker whose days are filled with gunfire and espionage, the young person keeping a diary.

From the publisher website
Shahida is both a historical-political essay that will make you reconsider your knowledge about one of the longest and cruelest war of the 20th century, and at the same time a game that will place you in the middle of that war, struggling to have a "normal" life, and being dragged into awful acts.

The last game by Ron Edwards, author of Sorcerer, Trollbabe, S/Lay w/Me. Shahida is the second game of the "Story Now" series, along with Spione: Story Now in Cold War Berlin.

142598.name: Candy Box
videogamehonor: 2014 D.I.C.E. Casual Game of the Year Nominee
142598.description:
User Summary

Candy Box is an ascii game that can be played online for free. It starts with... nothing. Just a counter of candies that increases and you can eat candies or throw them on the floor. But after a while... you will start an amazing journey!

boardgamecompilation: Among the Stars: Expanding the Alliance
142599.description:
Among the Stars: Preorder Promo Cards is a promotional Special Location card set given to customers who pre-ordered Among the Stars from Artipia Games.

The card set includes two copies of each of the following:


Ambassadorial Shuttle
Casino
Defense Grid
Galactic Expo
Waste Processing Facility
Xenobiology Lab
Zero Gravity Area
142599.name: Among the Stars: Pre-order Promo Cards

142600.description: Offered as a pre-order incentive for Container, these resin containers were made of the same material as the ships in the game. They are a functional replacement for the wooden containers that come with the game.
142600.name: Container: Resin Containers

142601.name: Ambiguity
142601.description: Welcome to AMBIGUITY, the head-spinning letter-turning word game. The Goal: Roll the eight letter dice into the tray and turn over the two minute timer. Now the fun begins because the letters on these dice are ambiguous and represent several different letters depending on how you turn your head to view them. Quickly study the "face-up" letters, without moving them, and write down as many words as you can spell, Players earn points for word length. The first player to score 100 points wins. So what are you waiting for? Get ready for some head-spinning fun.

142602.description: About two hundred copies of these wooden bills of currency were offered by Martin Wallace through his own publication house. They use the same, big, chunky wooden blocks used in the Treefrog Line version of Automobile, but printed with denominations on them. They were designed for use in Warfrog Games and games from the Treefrog Line, but of course can be used however you like.
142602.name: Automobile: Wooden Money

142604.name: Tiny Grumpy Armies
142604.description:
In this card game for 2 to 4, players assume the role of a video game mini boss vying for control of the kingdom. Each player must deftly manage their personal army of minions to kidnap the most princesses before the game ends!

This game has three different rule-sets, and while the initial setup is the same, the different gameplay rules provide vastly different experiences.
SURLY SKIRMISH is the recommended game for new players. It keeps things fast and light and theres a lot of immediate chances spite your opponents.

FOGGY FRONT-LINES is a simultaneous action blind bidding game, with the added bonus of an embarrassing hat.

CRANKY CAMPAIGN is a slightly heavier worker placement type game about careful timing and waiting to see the whites of their beady little eyes.

All game modes involve deploying squads of minions to claim MAP cards, which in turn have various effects, such us kidnapping princesses or messing with your opponent's army.
Also recruiting more troops into your army can give you a big advantage later.

Once the timer pile is depleted and the FINALE card is captured, players add up their final score (determined by the princesses they've captured) and find out who deserves to be crowned the next BIG BOSS.

142605.name: Consumers Power Play
142605.description:
A educational/trivia game about electrical power.

Pull a power card and answer a question determined by the color of the card. Answer correctly and move 1 to 3 spaces on the board. Follow directions on board space if any (move forward/back). Answer incorrectly and loose turn.

Winner is first person to land on or pass their starting space.

142606.name: Map Pack Storage Box
142606.description:
From the back of the box:

Be prepared for every adventure by collecting all your Pathfinder Map Packs in one convenient spot. Whether you're building the ultimate city, labyrinthine caverns, or an entire dungeon, have all the pieces at your fingertips with this perfect companion to the Pathfinder Map Pack series.

Maps for Every Campaign

Make sure your campaign follows whenever your imagination takes it with the complete line of Pathfinder Map Packs. From bustling cities to deadly dungeons, Pathfinder Map Packs let you skip the mapping and get back to the most important part of the game: your adventures!

142607.name: Keeping on the Borderlands
142607.description:
From the PDF.

Life is Nasty, Brutish and Short. So Are You.

Just on the edge of the human kingdom lies a valley whose cliff faces are riddled with caves. In these caves dwell a surprising variety of monstrous races: sneaky goblins, downtrodden kobolds, savage orcs, enormous ogres and stranger things still. These monstrous peoples are only tenuously united by the common worship of the bloody god Zemox.

The human Baron of Restwell Keep is supposed to keep the monsters under control, but there isn’t much he can do. Sure, every year or two you get a couple of self proclaimed “heroes” coming in to wipe out the monsters. But most of these adventuresome kids wind up on the wrong end of a glaive-guisarme. The monsters, they stick around. The biggest threat to the monsters isn’t the human warriors, but the constant infighting between monstrous tribes. Gathering together this many violent subhumans in one place is a surefire recipe for disaster. The valley is a fiasco, just waiting to happen.

142608.name: Go Team Superscience!
142608.description:
From the PDF.

It's a world of superscientists, boy adventurers, arch-villainy and globe-trotting action.

Big inventions and bigger egos. If you're not running the show, you're henching and biding your time. Or worse, sidekicking. Superheroes, super-spis,and super failures when you blow it. Saving the world, destroying the world;sometimes it's hard to tell what will do what.

Them's the bad breaks.

142609.name: Crabitron
142609.description:
Once, every hundred years, Crabitron descends upon the civilized galaxy to teach humanity a brutal lesson — to stop eating his delicious crustacean brothers.

Humanity never learns. It's time for their lesson.

Touch, pinch, and fling your claws to cause destruction
Battle against waves of enemies, including sharks with frickin' lasers
Gobble Burgers of Power, burp fireballs and suck in everything
Snap, crush and ruin everyone's day... or life
The world's most realistic Giant Space Crab simulation

Source: The Game Website.

Crabitron is designed around multi-touch interaction, encouraging players to play with four fingers at once for best results. Players place two fingers on each giant claw and can then pinch, snap and fling them to cause destruction.

John Millard, co-founder of Two Lives Left describes Crabitron as, “Like a huge, physics-driven puppet that players can push and pull with their fingers. He's this loveable, ugly crab with a wonderful personality.”

In addition to releasing Crabitron, Two Lives Left has announced their reverse-funding campaign “Crabstarter”. Crabstarter is a semi-serious parody of Kickstarter that bills itself as a “reverse Kickstarter” campaign.

Crabstarter presents Crabitron as a fully funded and finished game and asks players to back the project by buying the game on the App Store. All sales data for Crabitron, such as revenue and chart position, are made available to the public directly on the Crabstarter website.

Two Lives Left co-founder Simeon Saëns comments, “We'll be making all of our sales data public. You'll be able to see exactly how much we're earning, whether Crabitron is succeeding or failing, and where it sits in the charts.”

Two Lives Left has estimated that Crabitron cost approximately $100,000 to develop, and this has become the funding goal for their Crabstarter campaign. In addition, Two Lives Left has added “stretch goals” for additional features and updates to Crabitron once the initial funding goal has been reached.

Source: The Developer Website.

142610.name: Rescue Run
142610.description:
publisher blurb

Rescue Run is the first adventure in the Grendelssaga, a series of three adventures set on the rogue world of Grendel, in the Queen Alice’s Star system. Grendel is largely unexplored, an uninhabitable world in the next orbit out from the human colony world of Beowulf.

Rescue Run introduces the world of Grendel and its conditions, and is a sourcebook for the small outpost run by the University of Alicia on Grendel, studying the violent weather and emergent life forms. Characters must make their way from Beowulf to Grendel, across a system under dire threat from Kaefer marauders and human raiders taking advantage of the situation. Once on Grendel, the characters must survive the next storm until they can get themselves and the students away from the world. A hidden threat puts everyone at risk.

142611.name: Game of Familiar Quotations
boardgameimplementation: New Game of Familiar Quotations from Popular Authors
142611.description:
Similar to the game Authors, each card features 5 quotations from a single author. Quotations are read until someone guesses the author correctly.

From the New-York Times of August 22, 1863:
"Mr. John H. Tingley, of No. 152 Fulton-street, advertises a new game for the social circle, called the "Game of Familiar Quotations." It affords a very pleasant way of becoming acquainted with the beauties of Shakespeare, Cowper, Colley Cibber, Young, Coleridge and others, whose writings add beauty to the English classics."

142612.name: This is not a Minimalist Game
142612.description:
User Summary

This is not a Minimalist Game follows a warrior who finds himself in a world devoid of color, shapes and detail. Players must restore the world to its former glory.

Play the game here:
stormalligator.com/this-is-not/

142613.name: Dungeon of the Unknown
142613.description:
From the back of the book:

Located near the coast of hex 2214 of the Isle of the Unknown, this dungeon enshrines the mysteries of the Isle’s lost Minoan past. The module includes scaling information that allows it to be immediately and effortlessly used to challenge characters from 1st through 10th level. It features:

2 Dungeon Levels
20 Legends
2 Wandering Monster Tables
6 Sample Goop Monsters and a Random Generator to Make Countless More
12 Treasures
12 Weird Locations
19 New Monsters
7 Human Encounters

Along with the dungeon maps printed on the inside of the detached cover are keys that give an evocative appellation for each of the maps’ 75 encounter areas. The Referee can place the above 50 treasures, weird locations, new monsters, and human encounters in the blank spaces provided as he sees fit. Or, if he would rather, he can use the optional placements already given in the keys.

In any and all cases, the pontifical Referee is encouraged to add to, subtract from, and otherwise alter all within to suit his sovereign whims.

142614.description:
Introduction
TOPOLO is a 2 player abstract game that is played on the spaces of an 8x8 grid.

The Red player and the Black player have 32 cuboid pieces in 3 sizes(16 small pieces worth - .5 points apiece, 8 mid size pieces worth - 1 point apiece and 8 large pieces worth 2 points apiece).

Objective
Assemble your pieces into the largest orthogonally adjacent group to win.

Definitions

Group – Like color 1 or more orthogonally adjacent pieces.

Play
At the start of the game the board is empty.

The player holding the Red pieces plays first.

The row on the board closest to the Red player is considered row 1 followed by rows 2,3,4,5,6,7,8.

The Red player may place any one of his pieces onto any empty space on the board, then its Black's turn. Thereafter play alternates.

Example:
If the Red player has placed his first piece onto an empty space on the board that is within an even numbered row then both players must then play onto all the empty spaces of the even numbered rows first before proceeding to fill the empty spaces of the odd numbered rows. Now if the Red player plays his first piece onto any empty space of an odd row then both players must play onto all of the remaining empty spaces of the odd rows before moving play to the even rows.

The game ends when the board is full.

Scoring
Your score is determined by counting the pieces within the largest Group. Each piece within these Groups are to be counted as 1 point apiece, irrespective of their individual heights.

The player with the highest score is the winner.

In the event the largest Groups of both players are the same size at end game, each piece within these Groups are to be counted by their individual height point values (small - 1,medium - 2 and large - 3)and added to determine a winner.

For subsequent draws look at the next largest Groups of each player and apply the same scoring rules.
142614.name: TOPOLO

142615.description: You are a scientist who has to make jelly monsters experiments by finding the three different parts of the monster in the six different laboratories where the parts are... it seems easy, but all other scientists are doing the same! And of course, as usually at science, an experiment is never recognized until another scientist does so. Place your experiment and the parts at the correct lab and wait till other scientist go over and give it to you recognizing your labour. Every experiment is different and the score you may win differs because there are some parts easier to find than others. The scientist with the most points is the winner.
142615.name: The Jelly Monster Lab

142616.name: Wilde Möhrenjagd!
142616.description:
From the back of the box:
"Welcher Hase ist der Schnellste? Bei der wilden Möhrenjagd gewinnt derjenige, der als erster das Möhrenbeet erreicht hat. Lustiges Würfelspiel für Klein und Groß, ideal als Mitbringspiel oder für die Reise."

Translation:
"Which rabbit is the fastest? A game of "Rabbit eating Raddish" will be won by the rabbit that reaches the raddish bed first. A funny dice game for every age. Perfect as a small gift or to play during travel."

Summary of gameplay:
"Rabbit eating Raddish" is a 2 player roll and move game. Each player takes two rabbits of the same colour and places them at the start in tandem. The raddish bed is placed on the table 50 cm away from the start. On his or her turn a player will roll the six-sided die and move the rabbit in the back ahead of the front rabbit as often as the die says. The player who reaches the raddish bed first is the winner.

142617.name: Pathways (Issue 26 - May 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Faces of the Tarnished Souk: Ur-Shogga, the All-Consuming Thought
Twenty Questions with Matthew J. Hanson

142618.name: Beewary
videogameversion: TRS-80 Model I Level II edition
videogamecompilation: Leo Christopherson TRS-80 Animated Game Disk
142618.description:
Game Instructions

In this game, you control the Bee, which can "fly" at two levels. The "up-arrow" will put the bee near the top of the screen. This makes you safe from the spider (for a while at least), but you cannot sting the spider from this level. Down-arrow will put you in position to sting, but puts you within reach of the spider. The spider will get you, so be wary! To sting the spider you push the space bar. You may hold the space bar down for repeated stings.

This unique animated graphics game has SOUND. Simply plug the cord which now goes into the AUX of your cassette recorder into any audio amplifier.

142619.description:
“Defeat the opposing team by knocking out all of their players in the same turn or by getting to lucky 13 first on your SCORE CARD. Equip items and weapons to make your faction the strongest!” (From the rule book)

This card game recreates the pulp themed action that takes place in the Adventures of the 19XX graphic novel series. Each player receives a character card that comes with a unique set of special abilities and determines which side they’re on. Two factions battle to find a winner using one of two victory conditions:

1. Finish a round with the entire opposing team knocked out.
2. Be the first to score thirteen hits on the enemy faction.

Character cards are laid face up on the table with all stats showing. A marker is used to show the player’s current health out of a maximum possible five. Each player has a Luck, Defense, and Attack value. Every Character Card has a brief background description for those who have not read the graphic novels.

Over 100 Item and Luck cards with unique illustrations created just for this game are drawn each turn and equipped to increase your character’s attributes. The Item deck contains weapons and other helpful cards such as the Thompson Gun, Experimental Gas Launcher, and bandages. The luck deck contains esoteric items such as curses, lucky helmets, spells, and more. Using these cards you and your faction attack opposing players each round and attempt to get to thirteen on the scorecard. Each damage you inflict on an opposing player gets them closer to being knocked out and moves your team up one point on the scorecard.

The game also comes with 21 Chapter Cards. These cards are drawn each time you score a point and allow you to play through the plot of various Adventures of the 19XX books. These cards come right from the book series using the original page art.
142619.name: Assault: 19XX
boardgamepodcastepisode: Mechanics in a Name

142622.name: Lifetwo
videogamecompilation: Leo Christopherson TRS-80 Animated Game Disk
142622.description:
Game Instructions

This program contains two versions of LIFE. The first option allows you to set up a patter[n] and watch the resulting life patterns unfold according to Conway's standard Life rules... but at the amazing rate of 100 generations per minute.

The second option is the Battle of LIFE game... using the full brilliance of Leo Christopherson's TRS-80 graphics... plus the exciting addition of sound! Watch as the characters talk and move with sound effects!

Four life forms (biped, triped, uniped and quadruped) allow up to four players to participate. Each player chooses his lifeform (numbered 1, 2, 3 and 4 respectively) and places up to six of them at various locations on the grid represented by the numbers. Players may put all six on the grid in one turn or (more fairly) players take turns putting one of their lifeforms at a time on the grid. For two players, each player may take one lifeform or each may take two different ones.

After each 5 generations, play is stopped to allow each player to add two more of their lifeforms to the grid. Play is then continued.

142624.description:
Raving Prophet was sent out to participating Game Day stores earlier this week! Check with a Game Day store on February 2013.

Text on card:
Raving Prophet - 3 Runes
Enlightened Hero.
"Draw a card. Name a card, then reveal the top card of the center deck. If that card is the named card, you may acquire or defeat it without paying its cost."
Reward: 1 Honor Crystal.
142624.name: Ascension: Rise of Vigil – Raving Prophet

142625.description:
Mudfin Angler was sent out to participating Game Day stores on May 2013.

Text on card:
Mudfin Angler - 6 Powers
Monster
"Reward: Gain 5 Honour Crystals. Choose an opponent and name a card. The chosen opponent reveals their hand and you put any of the named card into your hand."
142625.name: Ascension: Rise of Vigil – Mudfin Angler

142626.name: Dubbio
142626.description:
from the user who submitted the item

This is the Italian version of the game. It got all the materials of the original version in a fancy boxed set.

from the publisher website

Doubt is two stories intertwined: real life and theater. By combining the techniques and elements provided by the game (set, actors, scripts of the show, etc.), players and director give life to a story that speaks of love, temptation, choices, loyalty and betrayal.

And the players are the ones who are going to choose how the love story of Tom and Julia, a couple both in their real life and on the scene, will end.

142627.name: The Upgrade!
142627.description:
from the user who submitted the Itam
Boxed version of the game in Italian, complete with booklets and handouts

from the publisher website
The Upgrade! is a reality show. The format is very simple: some couples are brought for a week in a luxury Upgrade Resort, in a beautiful and remote tropical island. Here the production creates the "right" circumstances, so that people are driven to choose a new partner. If, at the end of the week, two people decide to form a new couple they will spend another seven days in luxury and will also have the chance to win great prizes. The game starts with the beginning of the last episode. The clips run faster, presenting to the public the highlights of the show. All the backgrounds are revealed. Competitors must take the fateful decision: will they remain loyal or will they do an Upgrade?

142628.name: Doritos Crash Course 2
142628.description:
User Summary
In Doritos Crash Course 2, players race as their Avatars through various fantastical obstacle courses. Medals are awarded by reaching the goal quickly and can be used to unlock new courses, powerups, and decorative items.

142629.name: Shadow of the Eternals: Episode 1 - A Dream Within a Dream
142629.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – VAPORWARE




This game is stuck in the development limbo known as Vaporware. Few to no details have been released about about its gameplay, plot, or release date since its announcement many years ago. It may or may not be in active development, but neither has it been cancelled officially.




"Featuring an ensemble cast of heroes and villains, Shadow of the Eternals will span over 2500 years of history throughout Egypt, England, Hungary, and the United States. Players will question the perception of reality as they try to balance the mechanics of combat, magick, and sanity events to progress through the adventure.

Shadow of the Eternals will take players on a memorable journey throughout time; weaving historical fact with disturbing fiction to create an experience unlike any other.

The pilot episode of Shadow of the Eternals begins when detective Paul Becker is called to one of the bloodiest massacres in Louisiana state history at Pleasant View Hospital. The massacre is survived by two individuals who seemingly have no recollection about who they are or what has transpired.

Becker’s interrogation of the suspects brings us to Hungary 1610 AD at Čachtice Castle – home to the noblewoman Erzébet Bathory. Bathory is also a notorious serial killer; torturing and killing as many as 400 young women in her obsessive quest to retain her youth. You play the role of Bathory’s handmaiden and lover Clara, who is blackmailed by the authorities into gathering information about a missing nobleman’s daughter.

Events are soon set in motion that will change Clara’s life forever.

Episode Highlights

Travel back to 1610 Hungary and explore Čachtice Castle – the home of Erzébet Bathory
Use a variety of mechanics including magick, combat, and sanity to guide Clara through this horrific tale
Piece together a complex mystery while questioning the perception of reality"




Source: The Game Website.

142630.description:
Fútbol Strategy gives you teams of 12 footballers that share the same nationality to pick the six stars you want to build a game plan around and contest a fast, strategic, and fun version of the beautiful game against your opponent.

Move your stars into different spaces in their defense, middle, or attacking thirds. Search for space on offense while cover and closing down on defense. The action cards resolve play and serve as the game clock, referencing one of the six unique ratings that each of your footballers have, making each unique and interesting to play. Pass, shoot, clear, and tackle. Futbol Strategy has realistic rules for corner kicks, free kicks, and penalty kicks while remaining sleek and easy to play.

Midway through the first game both players will be very comfortable with the system. Games then will play in just 30 minutes despite offering interesting strategic decisions in the beginning and tense tactical decisions throughout.
142630.name: Fútbol Strategy

142631.name: Etrian Odyssey IV: Legends of the Titan
142631.description:
From Game Box:

For centuries, the tree Yggdrasil has been a constant presence in the lives of the people of Tharsis. But its roots are in a far-off land yet to be discovered. The ruler of Tharsis thus sponsors Explorers Guilds to uncover Yggdrasil's secrets, and you, fair adventurer, are next to seek fame, fortune, and the answer to Tharsis' oldest mystery!

142632.description:
From the box:

"Mark Anthony commands the combined might of Greece and Egypt, but the sorceress Cleopatra VII commands him. Together they field an arcane army like none that has walked the Earth, its ranks filled with undead from Egyptian tombs, creatures of legend, the mighty Roman 13th Legion, and even the ancient gods themselves - all barely controlled by powerful sorceresses."
142632.name: Arcane Legions: Egyptian Army Pack – Infantry

142633.name: Aquelarre Breviarium
142633.description:
From the back of the book:

Aquelarre es un juego de rol sobre el Medievo español, una épica mucho más cruel y despiadada de lo que las historias de fantasía nos hacen creer. Seas noble o campesino, deberás viajar por la Península Ibérica con el máximo cuidado, pues en tu camino no hallarás solamente hombres y bestias… Personas que han hecho grandes sacrificios para dominar las artes arcanas, seres malditos como los lobisomes, criaturas mágicas como los silfos, e incluso demonios disfrazados te aguardan. Las historias que vuestros compañeros y tú protagonizaréis serán peligrosas, repletas de desafíos y la promesa de grandes recompensas…, pero no siempre tendrán un final feliz.

Imitando el estilo de los códices y los libros miniados, Aquelarre Breviarium es la perfecta puerta de entrada al decano de los juegos de rol españoles y contiene todo lo indispensable para jugar, desde el sistema de juego hasta los conjuros y criaturas más importantes, pasando por un completo capítulo de ambientación que te ayudará a adentrarte en una de las épocas históricas más interesantes de nuestro país.

English translation by Google

Coven is a role play on the Spanish Middle Ages, an epic much more cruel and ruthless than fantasy stories make us believe. Seas nobleman or peasant, must travel through the Iberian Peninsula with the utmost care, as on your way you will not find only men and beasts ... People who have made great sacrifices to master the arcane arts, cursed as lobisomes beings, magical creatures like sylphs , and even costumed demons await. The stories that your colleagues and you protagonizaréis be dangerous, full of challenges and the promise of great rewards ... but not always have a happy ending.

Imitating the style of illuminated manuscripts and books, Coven Breviarium is the perfect gateway to the dean of Spanish RPGs and contains everything you need to play from the game system to the most important spells and creatures, to setting a complete chapter to help you delve into one of the most interesting historical periods of our country.

142634.name: Saeptum Arbitri (Pantalla del Director de Juego)
142634.description:
From the Publisher:

La pantalla del Director de Juego es el suplemento por antonomasia de cada cualquier juego de rol. Tras ella, el maquiavélico DJ oculta sus aviesas intenciones a los jugadores y mueve los hilos a su antojo para propiciar el destino, muchas veces funesto, que les espera.

Impresa a todo color y contralada sobre cartón rígido, la pantalla de Aquelarre es el suplemento de juego definitivo para la premiada edición definitiva del decano de los juegos de rol españoles (mejor juego del año 2011 Ludo Ergo Sum, Librea de Oro en los premios Armagedón de Ludotecnia y mejor juego español en los premios Poliedro).

Sus tres paneles (el central es un panel doble, con lo que realmente son cuatro en total) han sido ilustrados magistralmente por Jaime García Mendoza (ilustrador del libro básico, galardonado con el premio Poliedro a la mejor portada), formando un tríptico nunca visto en las mesas de juego. En el interior encontrarás todas las tablas que necesitas para dirigir y, por si fuera poco, el conjunto está acompañado por un libreto a todo color de 48 páginas en el que encontrarás:

Una pequeña campaña en tres actos, sobre un amor tan abrasador como inhumano.
Una aventura adicional que involucra a los personajes en una lucha del bien contra el mal.
Seis personajes listos para jugar, con sus historiales completos, ideales para partidas rápidas o para usar como PNJs.
Más de 40 nuevos orgullos y 40 nuevas vergüenzas para hacer únicos e irrepetibles a tus personajes.

English translation by Google

. The Gamemaster screen is quintessential supplement each any RPG. Behind it, the Machiavellian DJ hides his evil intentions to the players and pulls the strings at will to promote the destination, often fatal, awaits them.

Printed in full color on sturdy cardboard, Aquelarre screen is the final game supplement to the award-winning definitive edition of the dean of Spanish RPGs (Game of the Year 2011 Ludo Ergo Sum, Golden Livery Armageddon prizes Ludotecnia and best game of Spanish at the awards polyhedron).

Its three panels (the center is a double panel, which actually four in total) have been illustrated masterfully by Jaime Garcia Mendoza (basic book illustrator, awarded the prize for best cover polyhedron), forming a triptych never seen at the gaming tables. Inside you'll find all the tables you need to manage and, to top it off, the set is accompanied by a full color booklet of 48 pages where you will find:

     A small campaign in three acts about a love so scorching as inhumane.
     An additional adventure that involves characters in a fight of good against evil.
     Six characters ready to play, with full records, ideal for quick games or to use as NPCs.
     More than 40 new pride and 40 new shame to make unique to your characters.

142635.name: Fossil Fighters
142635.description:
From Game Box:

Welcome to Vivosaur Island, home of the world-famous Fossil Stadium, where dinosaurs revived from ancient fossils fight in thrilling battles! As a Fossil Fighter, you'll dig up dinosaur fossils, clean them, and revive them into powerful "vivosaurs," ready to battle. In your adventures, you'll delve into ancient ruins, explore sunken pirate ships, and uncover secrets that will shake the planet to its core!

142637.name: Fossil Fighters: Champions
142637.description:
From Game Box:

Ancient giants revived to battle at your command! The greatest fossil fighters in the world have assembled at Caliosteo Island to win the opportunity of a lifetime, to own their own fossil park. Take up your pick hammer and drill and join their ranks as you dig for fossils of ancient dinosaurs and revive them as mighty vivosaurs. Prove your mettle in a championship tournament that could change the fate of the world!

142638.description:
Explore with the eccentric Professor Pendergast and others daring enough to face bizarre encounters beyond the edges of the known world. Incredible Expeditions: Quest for Atlantis is a card game of deck building strategy for 1-5 players.

Wrapped in the inspiring artwork and portraits of the steampunk scene, Incredible Expeditions combines the riveting core gameplay mechanisms of deck-building, exploration and resource management.

Beginning at the Port City location, each Expedition Leader (player character) equips their unique ship with the Resource cards and Crew cards they'll need to make their way to the Lost City of Atlantis. As each new Location is discovered, Encounter cards are drawn to reveal the challenges the Expedition Leaders must defeat using the skill of their Crew and their Resource cards at hand. Encounters that prove too harrowing will leave your crew weakened, or worse, Cursed! The expedition moves on only once a Location's Encounters have been defeated.

Race against each other to be the first to uncover the secrets of the last Location, the Lost City of Atlantis, or band together to use your combined strength to face down Lovecraftian horrors and test your mettle against the hazards of expedition. Competitive, cooperative and single-player rules provide different play modes.
142638.name: Incredible Expeditions: Quest for Atlantis
boardgamepodcastepisode: Potion Explosion Review

142639.name: Firefighter
142639.description:
User Summary

In this game you are trying to prevent the spreading fires from reaching nearby houses taking into account the current wind direction and speed and utilizing water and "firebreaks". There are 3 difficulty levels.

142641.name: Wages of War: The Business of Battle
142641.description:
User Summary

Turn-based strategy game where the player controls a squad of mercenaries through a multitude of missions. The game is set in the future that is run by terrorist organizations and drug lords.

142642.name: Gryphon (Issue 3 -  Spring 1981)
rpgissuearticle: Freedom in the Galaxy Designer's Notes

142643.name: Skunked
142643.description: How high can you roll without rolling a one? The more you roll, the higher you score, the higher you score the faster you win. But, watch out that you don't roll any ones or you will lose your points and be required to pay a poker chip to the pot. The ultimate game of risk-taking and pushing the limits.

142644.name: Rise of the Rock Star
142644.description:
Rise of the Rock Star is a board game where players use 2 decks of combo-making cards and roll dice in a race around the unique multi-level board, rising in notoriety to become a Rock and Roll Legend. Players gain Fame Points to Level Up and to ultimately win the game. The variety of methods that players can use to gain Fame Points creates automatic momentum allowing players to focus on which strategy is best for each game.

Rise of the Rock Star is a game for 2-4 players ages 13+. Most versions of the game can be played in around 45 minutes, and several included alternate play methods allow game to increase and decrease in strategic complexity and length of play, making the game fun, customizable, and playable again and again.

142645.description:
Come and enjoy our cute, cutthroat, family friendly, card game where our dragons will...

Welcome you to the high fantasy world of Vallhyn. You will roam the countryside in search of treasure because you are a dragon — a young dragon, that is. You and your friends have just been kicked out of the nest for eyeing your parents' treasure hoards. The problem with being young is that you don't always succeed in your quest to find treasure, which often leads to havoc. To make matters worse, you must compete for the best loot with your friends by engaging in hijinks.

Havok & Hijinks is a fast-paced, light strategy card game that pits you against your friends in a race for the first respectable treasure hoard. Each turn starts with a quest for treasure that could lead to Havok like loot-hungry adventurers or beneficial heat waves. Engage in Hijinks by stealing and breaking your friend's shiny treasures or defending your own. When a dragon has a hoard with a value of 15 or more, it wins!

Contents

4 Double Sided Dragon Cards (Amber, Obsidian, Pearl, Ruby)
40 Hijinks Cards
40 Havok Cards
1 Rulebook

Game Play

Start your turn by flipping a Havok Card

Resolve any event flipped exactly as the card reads
Add any treasure flipped to your hoard




Once you've resolved your Havok card you may play one Hijinks card
You may also use your dragon's play ability

You may choose not to play a Hijinks card and instead discard one to draw one

Pass your turn

Microbadge(s)

- Fan Badge
- Darkness Affinity
- Fire Affinity
- Moonlight Affinity
- Sunlight Affinity
142645.name: Havok & Hijinks
boardgamepodcastepisode: AUG The Game of Crowd Funding Adam Trzonkowski Interview 08-01-2013

142647.description:
Alien Frontiers: Faction Pack #2 - Sunrise Commune

Fleeing persecution on Earth, the "Sunnies" came to Maxwell in hopes of finding a place where humanity would just leave them alone.

FACTION ABILITIES

OWNER: Pay one less ore than usual for any colony you land on a territory where you already have at least one colony.
FACILITY: Pay 3 fuel to move 1 of your colonies to a territory with no other colonies on it.




COMPONENTS

Faction Board
1 new Alien Tech Card
2 new Agenda Cards
142647.name: Alien Frontiers: Faction Pack #2

142648.name: Alien Frontiers: Faction Pack #3
142648.description:
Alien Frontiers: Faction Pack #3 - Brethren of the Stars

The Brethren are pirate crew known for hijacking ships for nefarious purposes. In their spare time thy have been known to smuggle tridium ore.

FACTION ABILITIES

OWNER: Use the Brethren Ship to replace any ship on the board and then re-roll and use the hijacked ship.
FACILITY: Move the Brethren Ship to an empty dock at the lunar mine and gain 2 ore.




COMPONENTS

Faction Board
1 new Alien Tech Card
2 new Agenda Cards
Brethren Ship (custom die)

142649.description:
Alien Frontiers: Faction Pack #4 - Prophets of the Artifact

Strange emanations from the Alien Artifact have given this group of technologies the power to influence the destinies of others.

FACTION ABILITIES

OWNER: Discard a face-down Agenda card to get 3 fuel or 1 ore or 1 Agenda Card.
FACILITY: Draw Agenda Cards equal to the value of your docked ship. Keep one and return the rest to the bottom of the Agenda deck.




COMPONENTS

Faction Board
1 new Alien Tech Card
2 new Agenda Cards
142649.name: Alien Frontiers: Faction Pack #4

142650.name: Cosmic Intruders
142650.description:
Back of Box

In this real-time video game, you try to shoot down the space creatures before they get close enough to your ship to destroy it. There are different types of intruders, each having a different point value. If you don't get them in your laser sights, and shoot them down quickly, then they will grow so large that they will crash into your ship! Cosmic Intruders was written in machine language to provide high speed action and amazing sound effects.

On the screen you will see three different zones. When an intruder is in the center zone, you may fire and destroy it. However, you may only fire when an asterisk appears in the left corner. After your laser is fired, it takes two seconds to recharge and for the asterisk to reappear. In the second zone you cannot hit an intruder but you are still in danger--the intruder may become very large and crash into you! The outside zone is the boundary in which the intruders are visible. It will usually be possible to recall an intruder that has recently moved off the screen.

The time remaining is displayed in the upper right, and the score is shown in the upper left. There are three different types of intruders, each having a different point value. These are the Z-shaped space probe, the triangular alien space ship, and the cosmic intruder himself. Each is worth a different amount of points. You will find that the aliens with higher point values are more difficult to destroy, while at the same time will move easily to destroy you.

An asteroid sometimes appears. This huge mess of interstellar rock cannot be destroyed, but it is dangerous as it can crash into you.

142651.name: Gobbler
142651.description:
Instruction Manual

Gobbler is an adaptation of one of the very popular arcade games that is being played by millions of arcade buffs each day. The object of the game is to consume all the pips in the maze while avoiding being eaten by the chasers who are constantly attacking and trying to eat you before you eat the pips. When ever you eat the long lines in the maze the chasers can then be eaten by the GOBBLER and you will receive a randome number of points from 100-700 while the chasers are not one solid color. Becareful because the chasers can only be eaten for a short time after each time you consume the long solid lines. When you clear the maze of pipps their value increases and you get a fresh maze an[d] continue playing the game.

142652.name: Flora
142652.description:
Plants grow, flower and wilt away as they produce seeds for the next year.

Flora is a quick and simple game played through four short seasons. During Winter, the game is set up. During Spring, players add tiles into an empty play area to form an initial group in any shape. During Summer, the group changes and grows as the players add two tiles and take one away each turn. The first gist of the game is that all these three actions must be used on different colours. Finally during Autumn, only one player takes a single tile and the game ends.

The second gist is that at the end of the game, the value of a collected tile is based on the tiles remaining in the group: multiple small, separate areas of the same colour make it valuable, but many of them might vanish or be easily connected into one large area, resulting in lots of negative points. Players also have control over the game's length and Autumn can arrive unexpectedly.

The basic two-player game has no structural hidden elements, it consists only of 11 red tiles, 13 blue tiles and 15 yellow tiles, and the rules are easily adaptable for thematic additions and personal variants.

142653.description:
In IncrediBrawl, each player guides a colorful cast of characters from all corners of the imagination as they meet in an epic clash for glory! Summon the right characters at the right time to outwit your opponents; use whatever strategy you can muster to overcome the randomness of the brawl! Amass the most glory along the way to become the ultimate champion in this crazy contest of luck and wits!

For basic gameplay, players shuffle their deck and draw five cards to start the game. Each player simultaneously selects a character from his hand and plays them face down at the current location. Once all the players have selected their characters, flip over the cards to begin the brawl!

After triggering any abilities revealed by the flip, players then compare their power type and power levels to determine who wins each scrap and the overall brawl. The winner gains one Glory (VP), plus activates any abilities their character may have that trigger off of winning. Each player then discards the played character, and draw one new card before the next round begins. The first player to reach ten Glory wins the game!

Each card in IncrediBrawl has a unique ability, and each player will start the game with a copy of the same set of cards. Choosing which character to play and what ability to trigger at just the right time is key to collecting the most Glory and winning the game!
142653.name: IncrediBrawl
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 27 The Geeks Don’t Plead The 5th On #Shadowrun
HouseRules 64: Talking Incredibrawl

142654.name: Schachadma
142654.description:
Schachadma (from "schach", meaning chess, and "adma", short for admiral) by Klaus W. Schomberg is a chess family game played on a 12x12 board, inspired by chess and battleships.

Each piece is a ship, with between one and four masts. Each turn, a player moves or rotates a ship, after which all of that ship's cannons fire. Enemy masts within range of the cannons are captured; when a ship has no masts left, it is also captured.

The tallest mast on the largest ship represents the admiral; capturing an opponent's admiral wins the game.

142655.name: Miho Player Book
142655.description:
From Introduction:

This contains everything you need to play the game as Miho, the well-intentioned, ultimately naive battle-android with a human heart. Once you have grasped its contents, you may be ready to try the full OVA game. With the full rulebook at your disposal, you’ll be able to create any character you want!

142656.name: Better Angels
142656.description:
From publisher blurb:

A demon gave you superpowers and it demands EEEEVIL!

In Better Angels, you play a supervillain trying to control the demon that gives you amazing powers—and you play the demon for the player next to you, pushing that player’s supervillain to greater and greater acts of supervillainy.

Do too much evil and the demon might take control. Too little, and—well, it’s a demon. It will find ways to punish you.

Better Angels focuses directly on characters’ moral stances. Is your villain Insightful or Devious? Cunning or Patient? Is your Courage as great as your Cruelty? Those characteristics drive your superpowers. They shape your relationship with your demon. And they are shaped by it in every scene.

Prepare yourself. There are diabolical inventions to create. Enemies and rivals to thwart.

AN ENTIRE WORLD TO CONQUER!

All it will cost is your soul.
rpgpodcastepisode: AP – Better Angels – “Apex City 1: Got Wood?”
AP – Better Angels – “Apex City 2: A Night At The Museum”
AP – Better Angels – “Apex City 3: Muni-Metered Justice!”
Better Angels: The Spared and the Spoiled episode 1
Better Angels: The Spared and the Spoiled episode 10
Better Angels: The Spared and the Spoiled episode 11
Better Angels: The Spared and the Spoiled episode 12
Better Angels: The Spared and the Spoiled episode 2
Better Angels: The Spared and the Spoiled episode 3
Better Angels: The Spared and the Spoiled episode 4
Better Angels: The Spared and the Spoiled episode 5
Better Angels: The Spared and the Spoiled episode 6
Better Angels: The Spared and the Spoiled episode 7
Better Angels: The Spared and the Spoiled episode 8
Better Angels: The Spared and the Spoiled episode 9

142657.name: Great Power
142657.description:
From publisher blurb:


With Great Power...

Comes great fun! Great Power is a complete super-powers sourcebook for the Icons Superpowered Roleplaying game, taking the powers from the game to new heights, with more details, more options, more depth, and more ... power! In its pages you will find:

New Power Generation Tables covering all of the powers in the book, and plugging directly into the hero creation rules in the core Icons book. Create heroes in minutes with just a few die rolls!
New Power Options: Expansions of the core Icons power descriptions to include new extras and limits and details on using them.
Power “Skins”: Ways of using existing powers, including the new options from this book, to create even more powers, from Acid and Android Body to Water Breathing and Wings, Great Power offers quick guidelines to help you find the power you want.
Dazzling Devices: Information on items that provide powers, from fairly mundane equipment to cybernetics, magic items, utility belts, vehicles, and more.




All this plus notes on using Great Power and Icons in conjunction with the popular Fate Core system from Evil Hat Productions!

Take your Icons game and heroes to a new level with Great Power!

142659.name: Hero Pack 3
142659.description:
From publisher blurb:

By ICONS Fans, For ICONS Fans!

Ad Infinitum Adventures and ICONS artist Dan Houser are proud to present Hero Pack 3, another collection of characters created for the game by ICONS fans!

In this 40-page PDF, you'll find 19 characters -- heroes and villains alike, inspired by the 1960s style of Jack "King" Kirby! Each character is fully statted for ICONS, with a full background write-up, and illustrated in the signature ICONS style by Dan Houser!

142660.name: Hero Pack 4
142660.description:
From publisher blurb:

By ICONS Fans, For ICONS Fans!

Ad Infinitum Adventures and ICONS artist Dan Houser are proud to present Hero Pack 4, another collection of characters created for the game by ICONS fans! This is the first Hero Pack created as a Kickstarter incentive, with characters provided by the backers.

In this 74-page PDF, you'll find 24 original characters, each fully statted for ICONS, with a background write-up, and illustrated in the signature ICONS style by Dan Houser! You'll also find updates to several iconic heroes as well as new iconics from the cover and interior of the Great Power sourcebook!

142661.name: ICONS Quick Hero Creation
142661.description:
From publisher blurb:

A two-page compilation of the hero creation tables from ICONS Superpowered Roleplaying for ease of reference or to "test-drive" the hero creation system for the game.

142662.name: CreaVures
142662.description:
User Summary

CreaVures is a puzzle platformer. Players control Creavures, magic creatures that work in pairs, to restore light to their dying forest. There are five different CreaVures in all, each with their own signature ability. CreaVures has three difficulty levels, 18 levels, and two boss challenges.

142663.name: Mega-Zyrr
142663.description:
From publisher blurb:


MEGA-ZYRR!!

Spy and soldier for the Zyrr Supremacy, the Mega-Zyrr is a shape-changing, power mimic from the stars and has his sights on the world's heroes! Also included are stats for Zyrr soldiers and a template to make your own Zyrr!

142664.name: Spider: The Video Game
142664.description:
Intro Video

Dr Kelly has just started an experiment. He attaches a spider's legs, then proceeds to transfer his thoughts into it. It is a success: the entire spider reacts. He seems to be able to see from the spider's perspective. However, MicroTech is secretly watching him, and MicroTech's leader, simply a brain in a jar, wants the technology. He either does not want to pay a lot of money for it, or is afraid Dr Kelly will sell it to another party, the former most likely. So he sends his best agents, a woman with special glasses of some sort and a man wearing sunglasses. The pair manage to sneak into Nanotechnology and enter his lab. Dr Kelly sees the gun the man is holding and proceeds to shutdown the experiment. The man starts shooting up the lab. Unfortunately, he accidentally shoots Dr Kelly, seriously wounding him. The woman stops him. The equipment is severely damaged before the shutdown could complete and is unable to disconnect Dr Kelly's connection to the spider, and Dr Kelly is seemingly electrocuted and collapses. The woman tries to remove the transmitter, but since the connection is still ongoing, it cannot be removed. So they proceed to kidnap the unconscious Dr Kelly and steal a case belonging to him, all awhile unaware that Dr Kelly's consciousness is being transmitted to the spider. So the spider (essentially now Dr Kelly) proceeds to follow the pair, in an effort to get his human body back. However, many strange creatures and obstacles stand in his way. And so, he must fight his way through in order to get his body back.

142666.name: Flash Arghhhhh!
142666.description:
Back cover blurb

"Flash Arghhhhh!" is a collaborative story telling game where you and you friends work together to tell an exciting story, just like those of the 1938 Flash Gordon series. Every player takes a part in the story, playing (of course) Flash, Dale , Zarkov and their many bizarre-hat-wearing friends.

Fly to Mongo, defeat Ming then battle your way to Earth just in time to defeat the Giant Rabbit attack! But there won't be any time to rest as Flash is going to rush off into adventure leaving everyone grinding their teeth and grunting out "Arghhhhh!"

All characters have attributes designed to add excitement and twists into the story with sessions structured to follow the classic Saturday morning shows, including the cliff-hanger!

This game is designed for the PocketMod format, print the game on a single sheet of paper, make a single cut, and fold into a little booklet giving you an RPG in your pocket!

142667.name: SpeedX 3D
142667.description:
"SpeedX 3D for Nintendo 3DS is a stunning tunnel racer that transports you into a surreal 3D world comprised of hypnotic graphics and otherworldly electronic beats. Offering four game modes, SpeedX 3D constantly challenges your abilities, introducing you to increasingly difficult runs at speeds that accelerate with every passing second.

Many have tried, few have succeeded -- the question is how far can you go without losing your concentration?"

Source: The Developer/Publisher Website.

142668.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 41 - May 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Doing It My Way: Extending the UWP: Starports
In A Store Near You: NHR 2000 Sensor Drone Robot
Kurishdam: Slice of Life: Technology's Effect on the 30th Century Family
The Shipyard: Schwartz-class Modular Spacecraft and Modules
142668.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #040: April 2013 (not updated from last issue)

Cover: Kraki H. Wodenssen

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from the Freelance Traveller web site.

142669.name: Publisher Dream
142669.description:
"Have you ever dreamt about making and publishing your own digital games?

Publisher Dream is a simulation game that sees you as the owner of a company called Triangle. Triangle focuses on a digital platform called 'cShop' for development and publishing endeavours.

You can hire people to develop various game genres, and control the game budgets and quality to safeguard limited resources. Do you want to be one of the biggest publishers on cShop? This may be a great way to test your skills before actually starting your own game company!"

Source: The Publisher Website.

142674.name: Building Savage Suzerain Characters
142674.description:
[Taken from the vendor site.]
Savage Suzerain uses the Savage Worlds engine, but has a few tweaks to the rules including Telesma and the change form "Power Points" to "Pulse".

"Building Savage Suzerain Character" acts as a guide on how to build effective Savage Suzerain characters without having to play through several campaigns in order to get a feel for character generation.

142675.name: The Sims 4
videogamehonor: 2014 Global Game Awards Best Management Game of the Year Winner
2014 Global Game Awards Best PC Exclusive Game of the Year Winner
2014 Global Game Awards Best Simulation Game of the Year Winner
142675.description:
The Sims™ 4 is currently in development at The Sims Studio for release on PC and Mac in 2014. The Sims 4 celebrates the heart and soul of the Sims themselves, giving players a deeper connection with the most expressive, surprising and charming Sims ever in this single-player offline experience. The Sims 4 encourages players to personalize their world with new and intuitive tools while offering them the ability to effortlessly share their creativity with friends and fans.

The Sims franchise is fueled by the passion and creativity of its millions of fans around the world. Your continued devotion to the franchise ignites the fire of creativity of the team at The Sims Studio, driving them to continually improve and innovate on one of the world’s most successful simulation game that has sold more than 150 million copies worldwide.

Source: The Publisher Website.

142676.name: Torchbearer Thank-you: Thief
142676.description:
From the Kickstarter page:

Enter the Thief





Thank you all for your continued support. To show our gratitude, Thor and I put together a new, seventh, character class for you—the classic Thief! Brave or foolish? Lucky or skilled? The thief walks a fine line, throwing caution to the wind in order to snag the loot or slay those who offer insult.



The Thief was designed in conjunction with Jared Sorensen. Jared's a huge fan of what we're doing with Torchbearer and…well…he's gone a bit mad and designed a pack of other classes in his wizard's tower. What else would you like to see?

142677.name: American Revolution 20??-The Rebirth of America
142677.description:
American Revolution is a solitaire parody game that pits the left vs the right in a fight to restore the nation to it's Constitutional roots. As a 'Patriot', you use political and military power to save the nation from a President that has usurped power to become a King-like figure.

In the game the player competes against the deck for control of strategic cities across the nation. A city card is drawn. Four opposition cards are drawn to represent gov't presence in the city. The player keeps a hand of 6 cards but can only play 3 per city to defeat the gov't presence. There are bonuses and penalties associated with each city, opposition, and player card.

The player must win 6 cities before the opposition (game deck) wins 6 cities.

142678.name: Wolfenstein: The New Order
videogamehonor: 2014 Global Game Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2014 Global Game Awards Best Shooter of the Year Nominee
2014 Global Game Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2014 The Game Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2014 The Game Awards Best Shooter of the Year Nominee
2015 D.I.C.E. Action Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Honorable Mention
2015 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Technology of the Year Nominee
2015 SXSW Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
142678.description:
User summary

Wolfenstein The New Order is a first person shooter. In this alternate reality, the Nazis have conquered most of the world or are in the process of doing so. They made a 1984 like world of concrete where everyday life is controlled by the Nazis. They got the overhand in WW-II thanks to the game's antagonist, a Nazi scientist whose inventions range from stealth aircraft to cyborg/undead Nazi super soldiers.

The game is set after the events in Wolfenstein: The Old Blood.

The protagonist joins the resistance in Europe, fighting mission after mission trying to turn the tide.

142679.name: 1916 - Der unbekannte Krieg
142679.description:
A First Person Avoider Game

In the light and thunder from grenades of the First World War, a young soldier negotiates the wet trenches. He is alone yet through the thick haze of mustard gas he sees the shadows move. Ammunition has almost run out and fatigue is distorting his perception. The soldier tries to find a friendly soul in the river of mud and blood. This is when the real threat appears. A pack of dinosaurs break through the frontline.

Grab what you can and head for the nearest ladder. The battlefield will bring you an escape from the prehistoric threat, but at what cost?

Experience the horror and senselessness of war. The enemy constantly hidden in the fog ready to pounce. Fatigue and shellshock distorting your movement and ability. The stress of uncertainty and adrenaline of chase followed by attack. Here, salvation is the blinding epileptic bombardment of the battlefield.

Source: The Developer Website.

rpg: A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying
142680.name: Guerra dos Tronos RPG
rpgitemversion: A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying: A Game of Thrones Edition (Brazilian Edition)
142680.description:
publisher blurb

Por anos, leitores de todo o mundo têm se emocionado com a saga de Westeros, contada por George R. R. Martin em sua série de romances best-sellers As Crônicas de Gelo e Fogo, e pela HBO no seriado Game of Thrones.

Agora, você pode contar suas próprias histórias nos Sete Reinos. Com Guerra dos Tronos RPG, o jogo de interpretação oficial da saga, você pode participar de torneios em Porto do Rei, liderar exércitos em nome de sua casa, explorar as terras geladas além da Muralha ou mesmo lutar pelo Trono de Ferro e tornar-se o senhor de Westeros. Este é um RPG novo, desenvolvido para refletir o estilo impiedoso da obra de fantasia mais importante das últimas décadas.

Para jogar Guerra dos Tronos RPG você precisa apenas do livro básico do jogo, alguns dados comuns, de seis lados, e um grupo de amigos. Mas cuidado: você está prestes a entrar em uma terra de aventura, guerra e intriga, onde o verão pode durar décadas e o inverno, uma vida inteira.

user summary

Brazilian Edition of A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying: A Game of Thrones Edition
This version come in black and white, with softcover and without the Peril at King's Landing adventure.

142681.name: Crash City Mayhem
142681.description:
"Experience high-octane driving thrills in glorious 3D as Crash City Mayhem comes speeding on to the Nintendo 3DS!

The more you destroy, the greater your rewards as you smash through city streets in a series of dangerous missions against an evil syndicate of terrorists!


Drive a huge variety of crazy vehicles including mopeds, supercars and tanks!
Drive anywhere - rooftops, sewers, inside buildings, rail tracks and more!
Unlock a stash of secret items and vehicle upgrades
Dodge the cops in a wealth of missions including high-speed pursuits, rescuing hostages and planting bombs!"


Source: The Publisher Website.

142682.name: Rob Delaney's War of Words
142682.description:
Rob Delaney's War of Words is a party game based on the tweets of Rob Delany, who has been named "Funniest Person on Twitter" by a number of media organizations. In the game, players are competing to be the first to cross a finish line, and they advance by doing well in three types of competitions, with the type largely being determined by the space on the game board where a playing piece is located:


"This Means War!" – On this space, the active player duels an opponent with each of them reading a Delaney tweet and the other players voting on who presented the line best.



"Firing Blanks" – The active player reads most of a tweet, but leaves a BLANK in the text. The other players each suggest a word or phrase to fill in the blank; whoever the active player judges best moves ahead two spaces, while this player moves ahead one space for each answer that he matches with an opponent.



"Loaded Questions" – This works similar to the previous category, but players are submitting answers to questions based on tweets.


Whoever makes it around the track first – whether through an exact die roll at the start of a turn or spaces advanced thanks to doing well on a challenge – wins!

142683.name: Duel-N-Droids
videogamecompilation: Leo Christopherson TRS-80 Animated Game Disk
142683.description:
Catalog Description

Your 'droid has already learned NIM, so now it's time to teach it how to wield a laser sword! Leo Christopherson, author of "Android NIM," "Dancing Demon," "Voyage to Valkyrie" and other animations, has developed a captivating animated character and high-quality sound.

Starting out as a lowly clown, your 'droid learns how to use a laser sword as you control its movements--advance, attack, even retreat if necessary. After training it to be a "Grand Master," you enter the tournament against the program's skilled 'droid. Revel in the fanfares of the victorious--or hear the funeral dirges of the defeated! Entertainment for all ages.

142684.name: Suspicion
142684.description:
Suspicion is a game of strategy and social maneuvering. As wealthy tycoons from the 1800's, players compete for power to take influence away from each other while trying to not become a target themselves.

Each round of the game consists of two phases. In the first phase, players play Arsenal cards with numbers ranging from -5 to 5 in value in front of themselves or other players one at a time. After each player has placed three cards, the three highest non-tied values gain control of a Power Deck.

In the second phase, the players with Power Decks, which consist of cards representing all the players, vote on a player to take Influence tokens from. If all three judges pick the same person, that player instead takes three Influence tokens from any players they choose. If all three judges pick different people, then the judges must each give one Influence token to another player of their choice. Otherwise, the two judges who picked the same person take one Influence token each from the player they targeted.

At this point, the Dealer passes the Arsenal deck to the player to their left who deals everyone three cards and play goes back to the first phase. The game ends when every player has been Dealer for one round. The player with the most Influence tokens at the end of the game wins.

Each player also has a secret Agenda card with conditions like "Have three 3's in front of you during the first phase of a round". If the player fulfills one of the three conditions on their card, they may turn it in and take the appropriate number of Influence tokens from any player(s) of their choice. They will get a new Agenda card at the end of that round.

142685.name: Snake Eggs
videogamecompilation: Leo Christopherson TRS-80 Animated Game Disk
142685.description:
Game Instructions

In this game you place bets and your snake will lay an egg, which acts like dice. Your Snake will play against the computer's Snake.

After the first two rolls, you may roll again until your score approaches 41, but you lose if your score is over 41. Each roll is from 1 to 22 points. You win if your total score is closer to 41 than the machine's. A roll of "SNAKE EGG" wins and a roll of "SCRAMBLED EGG" loses. If the final result of your rolls is the same as the machine's, no one wins.

This unique animated graphics game has SOUND. Simply plug the cord which now goes into the AUX of your cassette recorder into any audio amplifier.

Author's Website

I wrote the original Snake Eggs program for the Radio Shack TRS-80 computer in 1979. It was fairly well received, though not as well as Android Nim. The animation of the snakes, which roll eggs to represent drawing cards in the game Blackjack, was the highlight of the otherwise simple playing game. This updated version has all the cute animations, and then some. This game offers a modified version of Blackjack. The Help Screen shown below outlines the way the game plays. This version also features a macho male snake that orders the egg laying and two sassy female snakes with nasty temperaments that roll the eggs.

The original program was well tested by my 7th and 8th grade students back in the late 70's. This version has not had the advantage of a bunch of eager players, so, though I have tested it a whole lot, anyone who downloads it will also have a chance to find bugs (heaven forbid).

For this version, I have given the computer an average ability to win. There is no fancy AI for it to use. Randomness is mostly it. But then, Blackjack does have a great element of chance in it, I think.

Source: The Publisher Website.

142686.name: Leo Christopherson TRS-80 Animated Game Disk
142686.description:
Catalog Description

This is one of the greatest values in games ever produced. Leo Christopherson wrote the very first animated game for the TRS-80 and the country went wild for it. Androd Nim will make everyone laugh to watch these life-like creatures as they shake their heads up and down or side to side and blink at your stupidly as they wait for you to make a move. Then Leo invented how to make the TRS-80 produce sound and added it to NIM. He then followed Android Nim with the other games, even getting Radio Shak to sell Dancing Demons, which is a real scream. It alone is well worth the price of this disk; but you get ALL of Leo's programs on one disk for one great low price. If you haven't yet bought this disk, do it now! It is a classic! Each one of these games originally sold for $9.95 - $19.95 EACH. The disk includes the famous games: ANDROID NIM, BEEWARY, DUELING DROIDS, DANCING DEMONS (once sold by Radio Shack for $14.95), SNAKE EGGS, and ANIMATED LIFE. All games feature full sound effects and some of them are even in 3-part harmony! You and your family will just love this disk! Dancing Demon even features saving your song and dance routines to disk and four of them are included! The possibilities are endless and it is always entertaining. A great way to "show off" what your computer can do and always fun.

142687.description:
oddball Aeronauts is a simple, light strategy, played-in-the-hand (no surface required) card game of hi-jinks airship dogfights, set in an oddball fantasy world. Players take their Pirate or Pendragon officers, crew and bots, and go head-to-head in a duel in the sky.

The deck of cards is divided into the two factions - each player takes up 1 of the 2 factions, adds in Events, shuffles and the game begins. Factions can be customized in advance with alternative Officers, Support and Crew cards.

Each round, players declare and compare Skills - adding in any bonuses - and take the consequences. Additionally, cards have Special Actions. Use these during a round to rearrange cards, cause more damage, recover cards, get bonuses and more.

The player with active cards remaining at the end of the game wins.
142687.name: oddball Äeronauts
boardgamepodcastepisode: Dice Tower News 222 - February 21, 2014
Episode 37 The Oddball Draco Aeronauts Magi Happy Fun Time
Episode 4: Vacation Gaming

142688.name: Althingi
142688.description:
Althingi is a historical game for 3-5 players.

Players compete against each other to become the icelandic lawspeaker by controlling the provinces and thus having more influence during the periodic trials which bring order as well as chaos.

Every turn new provinces are added in contest while players try to gain them through an auction. It will be with that provinces and the wise use of the few action cards you get every turn that you'll fight to win the later trials, which are won by the player with most influence points. At the end of the game, the player with most won trials will be the winner. Or at least will get more chances to be the winner.

142689.name: Wer ist Walli?
142689.description:
The twelve wooden animals are placed in the center.
Question card is drawn and question is asked about one of the 12 animals. Child who first know the answer takes the animal.
If all animals is taken the player with the most animals is the winner.

Many other game-variants included.

142690.name: Mind Your Step!
142690.description:
Mind Your Step! is a press-your-luck card game where players try to earn the most money collecting flowers in the desert to sell. This Game was designed for the 24 hour contest - May 2013

"They said it would be easy, you thought it would be simple, go and collect flowers to sell at the market - what could go wrong!? That was until you met the Rats, no ordinary rats - these are definitely of an unusual size, but they are nothing compared to the fearsome Scorpions."

Players take turns to roll the dice and spend those points on drawing cards. There are four decks to choose from, each deck costs a different amount to draw a card. The more expensive the cards the greater the value of the flowers in the decks, but the higher the risk of drawing a scorpion and leaving with nothing. Players must decide whether to risk it and draw from the more valuable decks or play it safe with a cheap deck that guarantees they earn at least some money. Rolling a double on the dice will let you choose between 2 cards so should be safer, but do you keep trying for a double or take the bonus for leaving without uncovering a Rat. Ending your turn lets you sell your flowers at the market for coin, and at the end of the game whoever has the most coin wins.

142691.name: World Series of Yahtzee
142691.description: World Series of Yahtzee is a simultaneous rolling game using the familiar Yahtzee mechanic. Tiles showing hand objectives are shuffled and 8 are placed on the raised board. Players receive unlimited simultanteous rolls until one of them presses the electronic lockout device, giving their opponents 5 seconds to also signal in to claim a tile. When the music ends, scoring players may pick a tile that matches their hand and then keep the associated points.

142693.name: Ninja Slash
142693.description:
User Summary
An endless runner game. You are controlling a ninja, who is ever running forward, slashing zombies in your way. You'll have to avoid obstacles, while killing as many zombies as you can.

On your run, you will pick up scrolls that will temporarily give you special powers. You can complete missions that will increase your score in this run and future runs, and collect coins to purchase upgrades for your next run.

142694.name: Mystique Chain
142694.description:
Mystique Chain is a cardgame played with The Mystique Deck.

Players try not to "break" the Mystique Chain by finding cards that share exactly one feature with the card taken before.

The deck is shuffled and 30 randomly chosen cards are placed on the table face up. Then both players draw one of the remaining cards. The card with the lower card number is immediately put to the discard pile, and so are also all the cards not reveald.
The player who drew the card with the higher card number chooses one of the three features of this card (Colour, Suit, Number) and puts the card on the discard pile. (During the first turn, he may not choose a card and a criteria that does not allwo the other player to find a matching card)

Then the other player must find a card that shares this feature, but none of the other two features of the card just discarded.
He chooses a card that fits this criterias, names a feature of this card and puts it to the discard pile. The game continues this way as long as players find fitting cards.

As soon as a player can´t find a fitting card, he loses the game.

142695.name: The Streets of Marienburg
142695.description:
User summary:
A Warhammer reskin of World of Dungeons.

142696.name: Bikini Party Massacre
142696.description:
From Introduction:

An overnight swim meet/slumber party goes horribly wrong as the new school gardener, an escapee from a mental hospital, begins slaughtering the members one by one. This should have the feel of a bad B-horror movie, where the deaths are violent and bloody, and they should always stretch your sense of belief. One by one, the girls are lured away and killed by a homicidal madman wielding a gas-powered hedge trimmer: Murray Martin. This is another Halloween or My Bloody Valentine-type of scenario to be played with lots of screams and jiggles.

142697.name: Dead by Morning
142697.description:
From Introduction:
